<MembersIndexItem
  type="enum"
  name={<>:  &#123; <a href="#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef">...</a> &#125;</>}>
The terms &quot;backedge taken count&quot; and &quot;exit count&quot; are used interchangeably to refer to the number of times the backedge of a loop has executed before the loop is exited. <a href="#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="enum"
  name={<>:  &#123; <a href="#a9f7c88892cfe1646082bf6174a4b912c">...</a> &#125;</>}>
An enum describing the relationship between a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> and a loop. <a href="#a9f7c88892cfe1646082bf6174a4b912c">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="enum"
  name={<>:  &#123; <a href="#a899d8027fa6af3ca29aae6d88b6050ef">...</a> &#125;</>}>
A predicate is said to be monotonically increasing if may go from being false to being true as the loop iterates, but never the other way around. <a href="#a899d8027fa6af3ca29aae6d88b6050ef">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

## Description {#details}

The main scalar evolution driver.

Because client code (intentionally) can&#39;t do much with the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> objects directly, they must ask this class for services.

Definition at line 447 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>.

### computeConstantDifference() {#ae0ca564918ec63a9b4d2229374fec747}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; APInt &gt; ScalarEvolution::computeConstantDifference (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; RHS)</>}>
Compute <code>LHS</code> - <code>RHS</code> and returns the result as an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> if it is a constant, and std::nullopt if it isn&#39;t.

This is intended to be a cheaper version of getMinusSCEV. We can be frugal here since we just bail out of actually constructing and canonicalizing an expression in the cases where the result isn&#39;t going to be a constant.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01301">1301</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l12058">12058</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### computeExitLimitFromCond() {#a26b05f5967d446ef422d44a79334542c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScalarEvolution::ExitLimit ScalarEvolution::computeExitLimitFromCond (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; ExitCond, bool ExitIfTrue, bool ControlsOnlyExit, bool AllowPredicates=false)</>}>
Compute the number of times the backedge of the specified loop will execute if its exit condition were a conditional branch of ExitCond.

<code>ControlsOnlyExit</code> is true if ExitCond directly controls the only exit branch. In this case, we can assume that the loop exits only if the condition is true and can infer that failing to meet the condition prior to integer wraparound results in undefined behavior.

If <code>AllowPredicates</code> is set, this call will try to use a minimal set of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicates in order to return an exact answer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01167">1167</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l08971">8971</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### containsAddRecurrence() {#a62b3c09f031f2478ebd6c92b8c80aa2f}

### getBackedgeTakenCount() {#a22d9bcbd44563106d7217f3bd9a4039e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getBackedgeTakenCount (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef">ExitCountKind</a> Kind=<a href="#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefab1761348a1f6ac41658c85ffdd2d9361">Exact</a>)</>}>
If the specified loop has a predictable backedge-taken count, return it, otherwise return a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a> object.

The backedge-taken count is the number of times the loop header will be branched to from within the loop, assuming there are no abnormal exists like exception throws. This is one less than the trip count of the loop, since it doesn&#39;t count the first iteration, when the header is branched to from outside the loop.

Note that it is not valid to call this method on a loop without a loop-invariant backedge-taken count (see hasLoopInvariantBackedgeTakenCount).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l00894">894</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l08348">8348</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getExitCount() {#ab24add5df0874cdfa47b47b1d9926e9e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getExitCount (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; ExitingBlock, <a href="#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef">ExitCountKind</a> Kind=<a href="#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecefab1761348a1f6ac41658c85ffdd2d9361">Exact</a>)</>}>
Return the number of times the backedge executes before the given exit would be taken; if not exactly computable, return <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a>.

For a single exit loop, this value is equivelent to the result of getBackedgeTakenCount. The loop is guaranteed to exit (via <em>some</em> exit) before the backedge is executed (ExitCount + 1) times. Note that there is no guarantee about <em>which</em> exit is taken on the exiting iteration.

### getMinTrailingZeros() {#a765b135bf0191fca6004b4167bcfb493}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint32&#95;t ScalarEvolution::getMinTrailingZeros (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; S)</>}>
Determine the minimum number of zero bits that S is guaranteed to end in (at every loop iteration).

It is, at the same time, the minimum number of times S is divisible by 2. For example, given &#123;4,+,8&#125; it returns 2. If S is guaranteed to be 0, it returns the bitwidth of S.

### getMinusSCEV() {#a8bcb86d8d126d95b0dc05f09e8f3df96}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getMinusSCEV (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; RHS, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">SCEV::NoWrapFlags</a> Flags=<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa23e74052c4d79cfdaa23460a3c946656">SCEV::FlagAnyWrap</a>, unsigned Depth=0)</>}>
Return LHS-RHS.

Minus is represented in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> as A+B&#42;-1.

If the LHS and RHS are pointers which don&#39;t share a common base (according to <a href="#ac276ea1907c780c43d3637ae9bd1989e">getPointerBase()</a>), this returns a <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scevcouldnotcompute">SCEVCouldNotCompute</a>. To compute the difference between two unrelated pointers, you can explicitly convert the arguments using <a href="#a4f28ee6ec3dad0938d2660c56168d91d">getPtrToIntExpr()</a>, for pointer types that support it.

### getSCEVAtScope() {#a21d6ee82eed29080d911dbb548a8bb68}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getSCEVAtScope (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; S, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L)</>}>
Return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression for the specified value at the specified scope in the program.

The L value specifies a loop nest to evaluate the expression at, where null is the top-level or a specified loop is immediately inside of the loop.

This method can be used to compute the exit value for a variable defined in a loop by querying what the value will hold in the parent loop.

In the case that a relevant loop exit value cannot be computed, the original value V is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l00771">771</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l09854">9854</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getSmallConstantMaxTripCount() {#a4c58444d7945f3d5eda96b9b4fb095b6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned ScalarEvolution::getSmallConstantMaxTripCount (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate">SCEVPredicate</a> &#42; &gt; &#42; Predicates=nullptr)</>}>

### getSmallConstantTripCount() {#a2bf0e851d8784ff477a3bc34ae007ced}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned ScalarEvolution::getSmallConstantTripCount (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; ExitingBlock)</>}>
Return the exact trip count for this loop if we exit through ExitingBlock.

&#39;0&#39; is used to represent an unknown or non-constant trip count. Note that a trip count is simply one more than the backedge taken count for the same exit. This &quot;trip count&quot; assumes that control exits via ExitingBlock. More precisely, it is the number of times that control will reach ExitingBlock before taking the branch. For loops with multiple exits, it may not be the number times that the loop header executes if the loop exits prematurely via another branch.

### getTripCountFromExitCount() {#a17e35fd9a6e590c201fd05105589ce47}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getTripCountFromExitCount (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; ExitCount, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; EvalTy, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L)</>}>
Convert from an &quot;exit count&quot; (i.e.

&quot;backedge taken count&quot;) to a &quot;trip
count&quot;. A &quot;trip count&quot; is the number of times the header of the loop will execute if an exit is taken after the specified number of backedges have been taken. (e.g. TripCount = ExitCount + 1). Note that the expression can overflow if ExitCount = UINT&#95;MAX. If EvalTy is not wide enough to hold the result without overflow, result unsigned wraps with 2s-complement semantics. ex: EC = 255 (i8), TC = 0 (i8)

### getUDivCeilSCEV() {#a0daed958320635f1a9d440819f5bd487}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getUDivCeilSCEV (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; N, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; D)</>}>
Compute ceil(N / D).

N and D are treated as unsigned values.

Since <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> doesn&#39;t have native ceiling division, this generates a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression of the following form:

umin(N, 1) + floor((N - umin(N, 1)) / D)

A denominator of zero or poison is handled the same way as <a href="#a6c03d18ed744dc3b34829ec5485a68b0">getUDivExpr()</a>.

### getUDivExactExpr() {#aeca82ae7bafbb557b7026f7d035643b8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::getUDivExactExpr (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; RHS)</>}>
Get a canonical unsigned division expression, or something simpler if possible.

There is no representation for an exact udiv in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> IR, but we can attempt to remove factors from the LHS and RHS. We can&#39;t do this when it&#39;s not exact because the udiv may be clearing bits.

  prototype={<>bool ScalarEvolution::instructionCouldExistWithOperands (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; A, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; B)</>}>
Return true if there exists a point in the program at which both A and B could be operands to the same instruction.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions are generally assumed to correspond to instructions which could exists in IR. In general, this requires that there exists a use point in the program where all operands dominate the use.

Example: loop &#123; if loop &#123; v1 = load @global1; &#125; else loop &#123; v2 = load @global2; &#125; &#125; No <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> with operand V1, and v2 can exist in this program.

### isKnownViaInduction() {#afd0a71dc4e0ed5b83c50e875e6726661}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ScalarEvolution::isKnownViaInduction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmppredicate">CmpPredicate</a> Pred, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; RHS)</>}>
We&#39;d like to check the predicate on every iteration of the most dominated loop between loops used in LHS and RHS.

To do this we use the following list of steps:
<ul>
<li>Collect set S all loops on which either LHS or RHS depend.</li>
<li>If S is non-empty a. Let PD be the element of S which is dominated by all other elements. b. Let E(LHS) be value of LHS on entry of PD. To get E(LHS), we should just take LHS and replace all AddRecs that are attached to PD on with their entry values. Define E(RHS) in the same way. c. Let B(LHS) be value of L on backedge of PD. To get B(LHS), we should just take LHS and replace all AddRecs that are attached to PD on with their backedge values. Define B(RHS) in the same way. d. Note that E(LHS) and E(RHS) are automatically available on entry of PD, so we can assert on that. e. Return true if isLoopEntryGuardedByCond(Pred, E(LHS), E(RHS)) &amp;&amp; isLoopBackedgeGuardedByCond(Pred, B(LHS), B(RHS))</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01084">1084</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l10999">10999</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### loopHasNoAbnormalExits() {#a3db092f7661158b76135b3b7d39f0991}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::ScalarEvolution::loopHasNoAbnormalExits (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if the loop has no abnormal exits.

That is, if the loop is not infinite, it must exit through an explicit edge in the CFG. (As opposed to either a) throwing out of the function or b) entering a well defined infinite loop in some callee.)

### SplitIntoInitAndPostInc() {#ae7a40d693574be8048944e80774e6c1d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::pair&lt; const SCEV &#42;, const SCEV &#42; &gt; ScalarEvolution::SplitIntoInitAndPostInc (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; S)</>}>
Splits <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression <code>S</code> into two SCEVs.

One of them is obtained from <code>S</code> by substitution of all AddRec sub-expression related to loop <code>L</code> with initial value of that <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a>. The second is obtained from <code>S</code> by substitution of all AddRec sub-expressions related to loop <code>L</code> with post increment of this AddRec in the loop <code>L</code>. In both cases all other AddRec sub-expressions (not related to <code>L</code>) remain the same. If the <code>S</code> contains non-invariant unknown <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> the function returns CouldNotCompute <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> in both values of std::pair. For example, for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> S=&#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; + &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt; and loop L=L1 the function returns pair: first = &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt; second = &#123;1, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; + &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt; We can see that for the first AddRec sub-expression it was replaced with 0 (initial value) for the first element and to &#123;1, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; (post increment value) for the second one. In both cases AddRec expression related to L2 remains the same.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l01063">1063</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l10988">10988</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::computeMaxBECountForLT (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; Start, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; Stride, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; End, unsigned BitWidth, bool IsSigned)</>}>
Compute the maximum backedge count based on the range of values permitted by Start, End, and Stride.

This is for loops of the form &#123;Start, +, Stride&#125; LT End.

Preconditions:
<ul>
<li>the induction variable is known to be positive.</li>
<li>the induction variable is assumed not to overflow (i.e. either it actually doesn&#39;t, or we&#39;d have to immediately execute UB) We <em>don&#39;t</em> assert these preconditions so please be careful.</li>
</ul>

Compute the exit limit of a loop that is controlled by a &quot;(IV &gt;&gt; 1) != 0&quot; type comparison.

We cannot compute the exact trip count in these cases (since <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> has no way of expressing them), but we can still sometimes compute an upper bound.

Return an <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit">ExitLimit</a> for a loop whose backedge is guarded by <code>LHS Pred / RHS</code>.

### createAddRecFromPHIWithCastsImpl() {#a3f2351e880db97150c09300d5f36857d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; std::pair&lt; const SCEV &#42;, SmallVector&lt; const SCEVPredicate &#42;, 3 &gt; &gt; &gt; ScalarEvolution::createAddRecFromPHIWithCastsImpl (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevunknown">SCEVUnknown</a> &#42; SymbolicPHI)</>}>
Similar to createAddRecFromPHI, but with the additional flexibility of suggesting runtime overflow checks in case casts are encountered.

If successful, the analysis records that for this loop, <code>SymbolicPHI</code>, which is the UnknownSCEV currently representing the PHI, can be rewritten into an AddRec, assuming some predicates; The function then returns the AddRec and the predicates as a pair, and caches this pair in PredicatedSCEVRewrites. If the analysis is not successful, a mapping from the <code>SymbolicPHI</code> to itself (with no predicates) is recorded, and a nullptr with an empty predicates vector is returned as a pair.

</MemberDefinition>

### createSimpleAffineAddRec() {#aa1091a8a57e832868a4c5a8b513fe002}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const SCEV &#42; ScalarEvolution::createSimpleAffineAddRec (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42; PN, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; BEValueV, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; StartValueV)</>}>
A helper function for createAddRecFromPHI to handle simple cases.

This function tries to find an AddRec expression for the simplest (yet most common) cases: PN = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpurewriteundefforphi-cpp/#a2e83cb1bc3f5e8986cbd14575755a134">PHI(Start, OP(Self, LoopInvariant))</a>. If it fails, createAddRecFromPHI will use a more general, but slow, technique for finding the AddRec expression.

### howManyLessThans() {#aa059c79f1aa1bd0bc7f10105f5d185e8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScalarEvolution::ExitLimit ScalarEvolution::howManyLessThans (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; RHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; L, bool isSigned, bool ControlsOnlyExit, bool AllowPredicates=false)</>}>
Return the number of times an exit condition containing the specified less-than comparison will execute.

If not computable, return CouldNotCompute.

<code>isSigned</code> specifies whether the less-than is signed.

<code>ControlsOnlyExit</code> is true when the LHS &lt; RHS condition directly controls the branch (loops exits only if condition is true). In this case, we can use NoWrapFlags to skip overflow checks.

If <code>AllowPredicates</code> is set, this call will try to use a minimal set of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicates in order to return an exact answer.

### isKnownPredicateViaNoOverflow() {#aa79768fbd252f8de092490503bcd776a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ScalarEvolution::isKnownPredicateViaNoOverflow (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmppredicate">CmpPredicate</a> Pred, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; LHS, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; RHS)</>}>
Try to prove the condition described by &quot;LHS Pred RHS&quot; by ruling out integer overflow.

For instance, this will return true for &quot;A s&lt; (A + C)&lt;nsw&gt;&quot; if C is positive.

### isSCEVExprNeverPoison() {#af42e38b421af577479ffa88c08aac1b9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ScalarEvolution::isSCEVExprNeverPoison (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I)</>}>
Return true if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> corresponding to <code>I</code> is never poison.

Proving this is more complex than proving that just <code>I</code> is never poison, since <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> commons expressions across control flow, and you can have cases like:

idx0 = a + b; ptr&#91;idx0&#93; = 100; if (&lt;condition&gt;) &#123; idx1 = a +nsw b; ptr&#91;idx1&#93; = 200; &#125;

where the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression (+ a b) is guaranteed to not be poison (and hence not sign-overflow) only if &quot;&lt;condition&gt;&quot; is true. Since both <code>idx0</code> and <code>idx1</code> will be mapped to the same <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression, (+ a b), it is not okay to annotate (+ a b) with &lt;nsw&gt; in the above example.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h/#l02209">2209</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolution-h">ScalarEvolution.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp/#l07360">7360</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/scalarevolution-cpp">ScalarEvolution.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
